entry.title: More Adventures- starring Alchemist
entry.summary:
Author: velvet_alchemist

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 117,138Chapters: 35/35Kudos: 3

Summary: In this follow-up series, Alchemist tries to find connections between the simulation incident and her dad, all while the Court watches in the darkness. Will she finally solve everything and figure out the truth? TW: inaccurate medical information, I tried my best to research but nothing in the story is a completely accurate portrayal of medical procedures.

entry.title: Redundant
entry.summary:
Author: angelloserboy

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 735Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Jason hates this. Not because of you, no. You both have moved past that point of your...relationship, for lack of a better word. No, Jason hates this because it’s another gala where he has to act like he has to act like he enjoys talking to these pretentious assholes while sticking around in case of an attack. He didn’t care much for it when he was Robin, and he cares even less for it now.- - - - - - - -Listen To "Redundant" By Green Day While Reading This, Trust

entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,900Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 141

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life

entry.title: Mother of Exiles
entry.summary:
Author: scleraphone

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 46,323Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 128

Summary: Somewhere along the line, someone had told you that if you worked hard and honest, you could make a difference in people's lives. You moved to Gotham after college to help where help was needed. You knew it was a city that took time to understand, like familiarizing yourself with the cycles of a tide. What you didn't expect was how quickly you'd be pulled into the undertow.

entry.title: Strangers in the Night
entry.summary:
Author: unnamedmystery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,002Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 141

Summary: When the Daily Planet heard word of a new vigilante in Crime Alley that supposedly had no affiliation with Batman, Perry White thought it to be a nice short story—a quick in and out. After all, while the people of Metropolis had Superman, everyone knew of Batman, and a vigilante not working with him seemed interesting. At least, that’s what Perry told his college intern. And her mentor Clark Kent when he raised concerns. No one told her that the vigilante was intimidatingly attractive. Or that Crime Alley was the worse place in Gotham City. Or that her mentor would ask a friend to keep tabs on her. Or that the detective she’s staying with hates Batman despite working with him frequently. Or that the detectives neighbor was a really cute guy.

entry.title: last night i thought of you (years ago, when bodies grew)
entry.summary:
Author: artemissrx6

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,510Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 17

Summary: Sometimes you wish you never met him. The boy with the stars shining in his eyes, a smile so big it could light up the entirety of Crime Alley, dying so young and taking a piece of you along the way. You probably never would've taken up this hobby, would never start fighting and hurting every single day. If only he hadn't come back when he did, pulled you alongside him and got you scarred and tormented for the rest of your life. It's not fair, a part of you knows that, but he already admitted to using you and pulling your strings to have backup in his excellent plan to take over Gotham; trying to force Bruce to yield to his breakdown-derived ideas. He apologized, but you're not ready. Probably never will be, no matter how much your heart still yearns for him every single time you fall asleep. And no amount of apologies will make up for everything he's done. You may forgive him, but forgetting isn't even in the near vicinity of the table. It used be just you and him out here, but now, there are no strings tying you to this city, aside from vague nostalgia.
